column1: Shatura (Russian: Шату́ра) is a town and the administrative center of Shatursky District in Moscow Oblast
column3: located on Lake Svyatoye 124 kilometers (77 mi) east of Moscow. Population: 32

column1: A settlement on the site of modern Shatura has existed since 1423. In 1917
column2: peat deposits mining started in the vicinity. In 1918
column3: construction of the first peat-fueled electric Shatura Power Station began near the village of Torbeyevka (Торбе́евка). In 1919
column4: the settlement of Shaturstroy (Шатурстро́й) was founded nearby and in 1920
column5: the settlement of Chyornoye Ozero (Чёрное О́зеро) followed. In 1928
column6: the three settlements were merged to form the settlement of Shatura
column7: which was granted town status in 1936.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Shatura serves as the administrative center of Shatursky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Shatursky District as the Town of Shatura. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Shatura is incorporated within Shatursky Municipal District as Shatura Urban Settlement.

column1: Shatura is home to bandy club Energiya and Celtic F.C. inspired football club Celtic Shatura
